current-chamber.#text: IN THE SENATE OF THE UNITED STATES

official-title.#text:
To amend the Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act to provide greater flexibility in offering
			 health insurance coverage across State lines.

committee-name.#text: Committee on Health, Education, Labor, and Pensions

cosponsor.#tail: ) introduced the following bill; which was read twice and referred to the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: Commonsense Competition and Access to Health Insurance Act
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Commonsense Competition and Access to Health Insurance Act

text.#text: This Act may be cited as the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: Section 1333(a)(1)(A) of the Patient Protection  and Affordable Care Act
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act/s:1333/ss:a/p:1/sp:A

header.#text: Providing small business health insurance across State lines

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
is amended by
			 adding at the end the following:

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: Section 1333 of the Patient Protection	and Affordable Care Act

a report that describes
			 how the
may utilize the flexibility provided by

(relating to allowing a regional or interstate exchange) to
			 allow health insurance issuers offering qualified health plans in an
			 Exchange operated by the Federal Government to offer plans in a State

			 Such report shall describe how an Exchange operated by the Federal
